section.title: Per-user versus system-wide maintenance
section.para: The &MiKTeX; maintenance utilities (&MiKTeXOptions;, &MiKTeXUpdateWizard; and &MiKTeXPackageManager;) now come in two variants:

listitem.para: the standard variant is used to change &MiKTeX; settings for the current (logged-in) user
the admin variant is used to to change &MiKTeX; settings for all users

section.para: For example, packages will be installed in a private installation directory, if the current user runs the standard variant of the package manager. In contrast, packages will be installed in the system-wide installation directory, if the current user runs the admin variant of the package manager.
In order to run an admin variant, the current user must have administrator privileges.
The command-line versions of the maintenance utilities (initexmf and mpm) accept the --admin option to run the admin variant.

section.title: \write18 partially enabled
section.para: The \write18 primitive is now partially enabled: if the first token is a well known command (e.g., &epstopdf;), it will be executed. Unknown commands are still blocked.

section.title: &MiKTeXSetupWizard;
section.para: The command-line option --install-root=dir has been replaced by --common-install=dir and --user-install=dir.
The command-line option --roots=dirs has been replaced by --common-roots=dirs and --user-roots=dirs.

section.title: &TeXnicCenter; compatibility
section.para: &latex; terminates with GUI framework cannot be initialized if started from &TeXnicCenter; (1.0 Stable Release Candidate 1). Please visit the MiKTeX 2.8 Issues page for a solution.

section.title: Per-user &TEXMF; roots
section.para: It is now possible to set up &TEXMF; root directories on a per-user basis: users can register their private &TEXMF; root directories without affecting the system-wide &MiKTeX; installation.

section.title: Per-user package management
section.para: Packages can now be installed in a user-private installation directory.

section.title: Optionally avoiding the &WindowsRegistry;
section.para: The new setup option --no-registry causes &MiKTeX; to store configuration settings in a configuration file. By avoiding the &WindowsRegistry;, it is easier to create network installation of &MiKTeX;.

section.title: &MiKTeXPortable;
section.para: The new portable edition makes it possible to run &MiKTeX; from a portable storage device:

listitem.para: &MiKTeX; on a portable storage device is ready for use on any &Windows; computer
configuration settings are stored on the portable storage device and not in the &WindowsRegistry; of the host computer
no traces are left on the host computer
no administrator privileges are required on the host computer

section.para: Since &MiKTeXPortable; is installed by copying files (XCOPY deployment), it is now easier to integrate &MiKTeX; into 3rd party products.
&MiKTeXPortable; is distributed as a &SevenZip; self-extracting archive.
Please visit the &MiKTeXPortable; Homepage, for more information.

section.title: &TeXworks;
section.para: The &MiKTeX; distribution now includes &TeXworks;, an integrated development environment for &TeX; and &LaTeX; written by Jonathan Kew.
&TeXworks; includes a text editor, a previewer, syntax highlighting, spell checking, Unicode support.
This version of &TeXworks; is adapted to the &MiKTeX; distribution. See the &TeXworks; for &MiKTeX; homepage, for more information.

section.title: File type associations
section.para: &TeX; input documents (*.tex, *.ltx, …) and &PDF; documents (*.pdf) are associated with &TeXworks; (existing associations are left intact).
